title: CPRA Request: Flock Safety ALPR Records

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide copies of the following records from January 1, 2024, to the date of this request, unless a different timeframe is specified below:

I. Contracts, Funding, and Acquisition
Please provide documents for Items 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5 from the period between the inception of the agency's relationship with Flock Group, Inc. (Flock Safety) and the present.
1. All contracts, licensing agreements, software-as-a-service (SaaS) subscriptions, Master Services Agreements (MSA), and Memoranda of Understanding (MOU) between the Belmont Police Department (or the City of Belmont acting on its behalf) and Flock Group, Inc. (Flock Safety).
2. Any amendments, renewals, extensions, or change orders to the agreements described in Item 1.
3. All purchase orders, invoices, and records of payments made to Flock Safety.
4. Records identifying the specific funding sources used for these systems (e.g., General Fund, asset forfeiture funds, state/federal grants, or private donations).
5. All internal memos, proposals, or staff reports discussing the acquisition, approval, placement, or pilot programs for Flock ALPR cameras.

II. Policy, Privacy, and Governance
6. The current ALPR Usage and Privacy Policy, as required by California Civil Code § 1798.90.51, including data retention schedules and access protocols.
7. Annual ALPR audit reports required by Civil Code § 1798.90.53.
8. Training materials, policies, or directives provided to sworn and civilian personnel regarding authorized use of the Flock system.
9. Any Surveillance Use Policies, Anticipated Surveillance Impact Reports, or Privacy Impact Assessments related to ALPR technology generally or Flock Safety specifically.
10. The Belmont Police Department's records about agendas, minutes, or logs of meetings regarding the contracting, implementation, or security of Flock Safety cameras.
11. Documentation regarding public notification of surveillance, including signage standards, maps provided to the public, or press releases.
12. Any complaints or grievances received from the public regarding ALPR camera placement or data use.

III. Operational and Technical Data
13. A list of all current and planned locations of Flock Safety ALPR cameras deployed by the Belmont Police Department (including those in unincorporated areas and contract cities), including: coordinates or intersection descriptions, installation dates, the specific purpose for each location (e.g., traffic monitoring, crime prevention), camera model numbers/hardware specifications.
14. The names and titles of the specific System Administrators or managers responsible for the oversight of the Flock Safety system (e.g., Professional Services Division Commander).

IV. Usage Data, Sharing, and Audits
15. The total number of license plates scanned (read) by the Belmont Police Department's Flock cameras, aggregated by month.
16. All existing audit or access logs generated by the Flock Safety system documenting queries/searches conducted by agency personnel. I request that personally identifiable information of non-employee subjects be redacted rather than the records withheld. Please include: date and time of search, reason for search (as entered into the system audit trail), and the agency or unit of the officer conducting the search.
17. Records regarding the sharing of ALPR data with the Northern California Regional Intelligence Center (NCRIC), including but not limited to: 
- Any MOUs, data-sharing agreements, or network-participation terms governing the transmission of the Belmont Police Department's ALPR data to NCRIC; 
- Records describing the technical mechanism by which data is shared (e.g., automatic real-time feed, batch upload, or query-based access);
- Any policies, directives, or written guidance governing what restrictions, if any, the Belmont Police Department places on NCRIC's downstream use or further dissemination of Belmont Police Department-origin ALPR data;
- Records of any requests received from NCRIC (or through NCRIC from other agencies) to query or obtain Belmont Police Department ALPR data, and the Belmont Police Department's responses to such requests.
18. A list of all "hot lists" (e.g., stolen vehicles, Amber alerts) or custom "hot lists" currently integrated into the Belmont Police Department Flock system.
19. A list of all outside agencies (local, state, and federal) that the Belmont Police Department shares Flock data with, and a list of all outside agencies from whom the Belmont Police Department receives Flock data, including but not limited to access provided through Flock Safety's real-time network sharing features (e.g., the platform previously known as TALON), and any data-sharing agreements, MOUs, or network participation terms governing such access.
20. Any statistical reports or evaluations generated by the department or Flock Safety regarding the efficacy of the system (e.g., number of vehicles recovered, arrests made attributable to ALPR hits).
21. Records of any unauthorized access, data breaches, or security incidents involving ALPR data.

V. Communication
22. All written communications (emails and attachments) between Belmont Police Department employees and representatives of Flock Safety (email domain @flocksafety.com), excluding routine IT troubleshooting tickets.
23. All written communications with other law enforcement agencies or federal partners regarding requests to access or share Belmont Police Department Flock data.

If you determine that any portion of the requested records is exempt from disclosure, please redact only those portions and provide the remainder of the record. For any redaction or denial, please cite the specific legal exemption justifying the withholding, as required by Government Code § 7922.540.

Given that this request is made in the public interest by a student journalist writing for Scot Scoop, I respectfully request a waiver or reduction of any fees associated with this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Maximus Kwan

title: CPRA Request: Flock Safety ALPR Records

8. Training materials, policies, or directives provided to sworn and civilian personnel regarding authorized use of the Flock system.

10. SMCSO's records about agendas, minutes, or logs of meetings (internal or with the Board of Supervisors/Town Councils for contract cities like Woodside or Los Altos Hills) regarding the contracting, implementation, or security of Flock Safety cameras.
11. Documentation regarding public notification of surveillance, including signage standards, maps provided to the public, or press releases.

III. Operational and Technical Data

IV. Usage Data, Sharing, and Audits
15. The total number of license plates scanned (read) by SMCSO Flock cameras, aggregated by month.
16. All existing audit or access logs generated by the Flock Safety system documenting queries/searches conducted by agency personnel. I request that personally identifiable information of non-employee subjects be redacted rather than the records withheld. Please include: date and time of search, reason for search (as entered into the system audit trail), and the agency or unit of the officer conducting the search.
17. Records regarding the sharing of ALPR data with the Northern California Regional Intelligence Center (NCRIC), including but not limited to: 
- Any MOUs, data-sharing agreements, or network-participation terms governing the transmission of SMCSO ALPR data to NCRIC; 
- Records describing the technical mechanism by which data is shared (e.g., automatic real-time feed, batch upload, or query-based access);
- Any policies, directives, or written guidance governing what restrictions, if any, SMCSO places on NCRIC's downstream use or further dissemination of SMCSO-origin ALPR data;
- Records of any requests received from NCRIC (or through NCRIC from other agencies) to query or obtain SMCSO ALPR data, and SMCSO's responses to such requests.
18. A list of all "hot lists" (e.g., stolen vehicles, Amber alerts) or custom "hot lists" currently integrated into the SMCSO Flock system.
19. A list of all outside agencies (local, state, and federal) that SMCSO shares Flock data with, and a list of all outside agencies from whom SMCSO receives Flock data, including but not limited to access provided through Flock Safety's real-time network sharing features (e.g., the platform previously known as TALON), and any data-sharing agreements, MOUs, or network participation terms governing such access.
20. Any statistical reports or evaluations generated by the department or Flock Safety regarding the efficacy of the system (e.g., number of vehicles recovered, arrests made attributable to ALPR hits).
21. Records of any unauthorized access, data breaches, or security incidents involving ALPR data.

V. Communication
22. All written communications (emails and attachments) between SMCSO employees and representatives of Flock Safety (email domain @flocksafety.com), excluding routine IT troubleshooting tickets.
23. All written communications with other law enforcement agencies or federal partners regarding requests to access or share SMCSO Flock data.

If you determine that any portion of the requested records is exempt from disclosure, please redact only those portions and provide the remainder of the record. For any redaction or denial, please cite the specific legal exemption justifying the withholding, as required by Government Code § 7922.540.

Given that this request is made in the public interest by a student journalist writing for Scot Scoop, I respectfully request a waiver or reduction of any fees associated with this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Maximus Kwan

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Palantir x Denver
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

The company Palantir recently moved its headquarters to Miami, Florida. Source: https://x.com/PalantirTech/status/2023780511051809010 

Therefore, pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records (dated January 1, 2024 to the time this request is processed):
- Any communications—including emails + text messages + records of video calls over Zoom, Google Meet, etc. such as calendar invitations +  records of phone calls—between any Denver City Councilmembers/anyone employed by Denver's City Council and anyone at Palantir (email domain: @palantir.com) or any outside parties, such as lawyers, representing the company.
- Any informational documents, memoranda, agreements, etc. mentioning Palantir.

I respectfully request that my request is expedited, given the newsworthiness of Palantir's recent move to Miami, FL.

I am a news reporter for WIRED (wired.com), so the requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. Therefore, I request that any fees are waived. But in the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available.

If you need to contact me, you can reach me at caroline_haskins@wired.com, or here. Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Caroline Haskins

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Jesse Jackson
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into the Reverend Jesse Louis Jackson (October 8, 1941 – February 17, 2026), born Jesse Louis Burns. His death is widely-known and widely reported; as such, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. For example, you may find his New York Times obituary at the following link: https://www.nytimes.com/2026/02/17/us/jesse-jackson-dead.html

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but not limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs and/or links as well as a cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to 137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

I request that I be properly classified as a media requester. I am an associate editor at Reason Magazine who has written numerous articles on topics of public interest for the Daily Beast, the Asia Times, Responsible Statecraft, the National Interest, America Magazine and the Armenian Weekly, and I am requesting these documents in an editorial capacity. Please contact me if you have any questions about my media status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

title: CA CVR Data Request (2022, 2024) (Kings County Election Department)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: CA CVR Data Request (2022, 2024) (Kings County Election Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Cast vote record (CVR) data for the following elections:
1. 2022 Nov Midterm Election
2. 2024 Nov General Election

Specifically, for each of these elections, I’m looking for the full anonymized record of votes cast generated by the relevant voting system technology in your County in that year. In case it is helpful to see an example of the type of data I am requesting from your county, Alameda County has these records posted for the 2024 General Election on their Election Information for November 2024 under the name “Cast Vote Records (CVR) Report”.

Please let me know if you need any further clarification on the type of data that I am requesting.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aleksandra Conevska

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: NYDOT: Carrier Certification System Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I request a bulk data extract from the NYSDOT Carrier Certification System (carcert.dot.ny.gov), maintained by the Office of Modal Safety & Security, including:

All fields maintained for each certified carrier: certification details, fleet vehicle inventory (count, type, make, model, year), insurance information on file, inspection history, and compliance status
For all currently certified and previously certified carriers (active, suspended, revoked, and expired)
I request this data in electronic format (CSV, pipe-delimited text, or database export). I understand that certain fields may contain personally identifiable information (driver records, Article 19-A records) -- I am not requesting those fields. I am requesting carrier-level organizational and fleet data only.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ian White

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: NY DOT: Individual Inspection Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I request individual-level inspection records for all inspections conducted by NYSDOT's Passenger Carrier Safety Bureau and Motor Carrier Compliance Bureau for the past 5 years (2021-2026), including:

Inspection date
Operator / carrier name and Operator ID
Vehicle identification (VIN, plate number, vehicle type)
Inspection location (facility, roadside, or terminal)
Inspection result (pass / fail)
Deficiencies found (if any) with category and description
Out-of-service orders issued (if any)
Inspector ID or facility ID
Re-inspection date and result (if applicable)

I understand this is a large dataset. I am requesting a structured database export in CSV or pipe-delimited format. If the full 5-year span is too large for a single response, I am willing to receive the data in annual increments.

Note: I am aware that aggregated versions of this data are published via the OSIPD API and BUSNET dataset on data.ny.gov. I am specifically requesting the underlying individual inspection records that feed those aggregations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ian White

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: NYDOT: Truck/Freight Carrier Operator Profiles
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

NYSDOT's Truck & Motor Carrier Safety website states that truck and freight carrier operator profiles are "available by written request." I am requesting a bulk dataset of all truck/freight carrier operator profiles maintained by NYSDOT's Office of Modal Safety & Security, Truck & Motor Carrier Safety division, including:

Carrier / operator name
NYSDOT registration or permit number
Business address
USDOT number (if on file)
Number of vehicles
Vehicle types operated
Operating authority type (intrastate, for-hire, private, etc.)
Registration status (active, expired, suspended)
Registration effective and expiration dates
Any safety ratings or compliance status
I request this data in electronic format (CSV or pipe-delimited text file).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ian White

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: NYDOT: Enforcement Actions
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I request records of all enforcement actions taken by NYSDOT's Office of Modal Safety & Security (Passenger Carrier Safety Bureau, Truck & Motor Carrier Safety, and Motor Carrier Compliance Bureau) against certified passenger carriers and registered motor carriers for the past 10 years, including:

Carrier name and Operator ID / Certification number
Action type (suspension, revocation, fine, warning, consent order, cease and desist)
Action date
Effective date and duration (if temporary suspension)
Reason / basis for action (violation description or citation)
Resolution (if resolved -- reinstatement date, fine paid, etc.)
Current status of the action (active, resolved, appealed)

I request this data in electronic format (CSV or pipe-delimited text). If enforcement records are maintained in a database, I am requesting a structured export rather than copies of individual documents.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ian White

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: NYDOT: Certified Passenger Carrier List
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I request the following records maintained by the NYSDOT Office of Modal Safety & Security, Passenger Carrier Safety Bureau:

A list of all passenger carriers currently certified or previously certified by NYSDOT, including the following fields for each carrier:

Carrier name (legal name and DBA if different)
NYSDOT Operator ID / Certification number
Certification type (school bus, motorcoach, ambulette, for-hire passenger, charter, etc.)
Certification status (active, suspended, revoked, expired, pending)
Certification effective date
Certification expiration date (if applicable)
Suspension or revocation date and reason (if applicable)
Business address (street, city, state, zip)
County
NYSDOT region
USDOT number (if on file)
Number of vehicles authorized

I request this data in electronic format, preferably as a CSV or pipe-delimited text file. If the full dataset is too large for email delivery, I am willing to receive it via a file-sharing link or on physical media.

If any portion of this request is denied, please provide the specific statutory basis for the denial and release the remaining non-exempt portions.

I am willing to discuss narrowing the scope of this request if it is deemed unreasonably burdensome. Please contact me at [email/phone] to discuss.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ian White

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: CPS LRE Distribution
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Case managers in local schools can run reports. CPS officials can also run reports on specific schools.

Please provide the following:

A report showing the LRE distribution in Courtenay Elementary school by homeroom.

A report showing the LRE distribution in Funston Elementary school by homeroom.

A report showing the LRE distribution in Mount Greenwood school by homeroom.

I am not looking for student specific information. I am only seeking Least Restrictive Environment information. This can be provided in aggregate or disaggregated. There should be a column listing Least Restrictive Environment by 1, 2 or 3. I do not want anonymized student IDs but one row of data should correspond to one student (if produced in disaggregated form). 

This request is made on behalf of The FOIA Bakery. Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Sheikh Abdulkadir ICE Death Report
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. The ICE Detainee Death Report for Fouad Saeed Abdulkadir, who passed away December 14, 2025, in ICE custody in Pennsylvania. 
2. A copy of the ICE ERO or IHSC Significant Incident Report or Significant Event Notification

According to the information currently published on ICE's website, ICE was under a Congressional mandate to release this information no later than 30 days after his death, and to update it no more than 60 days after each immigrant's death. 

I make this request under both 5 USC 552(a)(2) - which governs the agency's affirmative disclosure obligations - and 552(a)(3), which concerns the agency's obligation to respond to a request. 

Pursuant to 6 C.F.R. 5.5(e)(1)(ii) and (iv), I seek expedited processing of this request, and certify and attest under penalty of perjury pursuant to 28 USC 1746 that the following statements are true and correct to the best of my knowledge and current understanding: 

1. I am a member of the media, primarily engaged information dissemination. See www.MuckRack.com/Andrew-Free.

2. I research and publish regarding deaths in ICE custody. My work documenting deaths in ICE detention is published, cited, and relied upon by national media outlets, including the Washington Post, the New York Times, the L.A. Times, and others. 

3. As of the date of filing my filing of this request, ICE has not posted its Detainee Death Report for this individual. 

4. There is an urgent need to inform the public about the circumstances ICE is aware of surrounding this death. Congress is currently contemplating alterations to DHS and ICE's funding, and the facts of each death in custody directly impact demands lawmakers and the public may wish to press when authorizing future funding increases, or applying limits to them.

5. Deaths in ICE custody reached their highest numbers in 20 years in 2025, and they have been the subject of widespread media coverage, and there is significant reason to believe ICE's treatment of people in detention has not met the standards it claims it adheres to when defending its actions in public statements. This coverage has prompted a number of responses by DHS's Twitter page and other public statements, pushing back against the coverage.

6. I will make the records available to the general public upon receiving them.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Cheektowaga Flock Audit
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Records related to the department’s Flock Safety system:
1. Organization Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of January 1, 2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of January 1, 2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

3. A list of network share settings that include:
3a. Flock networks shared with me
3b. Networks that I’m sharing - including access for each organization (eg. "Search", "Hotlist", "Analytics")

Please do not direct me to a Flock transparency page, as transparency pages do not contain the totality of responsive information for this request, such as organizations' access for shared networks or complete organization or network audits.

Please provide records in their original electronic, machine readable format. For example, please provide csv or spreadsheet files where applicable.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Scott Conway

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: GE Video
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. All extant video of Chaofeng GE entering the shower area in his pod at the Moshannon Valley ICE Processing center from the early morning hours of August 5, 2026, depicting the period beginning when he enters through the shower stall where he ended his life until the period where he is discovered by GEO staff or detained immigrants. 

2. Any photos of Mr. Ge's remains taken at the MVPC.

3. Any extant versions of a Significant Incident Report or Significant Event Notification ICE created pertaining to Mr. Ge's death. 

4. The working papers from IHSC's Mortality Review for Mr. Ge's death. 

Pursuant to 6 C.F.R. 5.5(e), I hereby request expedited processing of this request, and affirm under penalty of perjury pursuant to 28 USC 1746 that the following statements in support thereof are true and correct to the best of my knowledge and understanding: 

1. I am a member of the media primarily engaged in information dissemination. I published edited works in local and national outlets regarding, inter alia, ICE detention and deaths in custody. Www.MuckRack.com/Andrew-Free. I also publish a subscription-based online newsletter about deaths in custody, www.detetentionkills.substack.com. I am a member of Investigative Reporters and Editors (IRE), a professional organization available only to journalists. 

2. According to an autopsy report I have reviewed concerning Mr. Ge's death, he was hogtied with his hands and feet behind his back when his body was found. 

3. While his death was ruled a suicide by hanging by the Coroner, significant speculation about potential abuse preceding Mr. Ge's death has proliferated in the media, causing his family and other detained immigrants at Moshannon, as well as the public, unnecessary pain, confusion, and doubt as to the circumstances surrounding his death. 

4. Adding to the confusion, ICE failed to disclose all the circumstances surrounding Mr. Ge's death in its congressionally mandated Detainee Death Report: https://www.ice.gov/doclib/foia/reports/ddrChaofengGe.pdf. ICE omitted the fact that his hands and feet were bound together behind Mr. Ge's back when his body was discovered. 

5. Due to the confusion ICE's less-than-complete communications have engendered, there is an urgency to inform the public about the circumstances surrounding his death. 

6. Mr. Ge's death and deaths in ICE custody during 2025 have been the subject of widespread media attention about which there exist questions as to the government's adherence to its own standards, and its enforcement of federal laws pertaining to ICE's contractors. 

7. This sustained media attention has drawn official statements by ICE's social media and DHS spokespeople, Congressional questioning, and numerous "fact-checks" from the administration. 

8. ICE is poised to add approximately 92,000 beds to its detention system in the next several months. 

9. ICE's FOIA backlog currently stretches back years--meaning treatment of this request in the ordinary course of business will render the answers to questions about Mr. Ge's death moot and purely historical in nature. 

10. GEO's contract with Clearfield County is set for renewal in 2026. Prior to approving that contract, the public has a right to know how Mr. Ge died, and what GEO did to prevent it. Because ICE refuses to affirmatively release this information, expedited processing is necessary to obtain it.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

title: GSA: Appraisal and Fair Market Value Justification for 1365 E Hightower Trail, Social Circle, GA (Parcel ID: SC23000000006000)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: GSA: Appraisal and Fair Market Value Justification for 1365 E Hightower Trail, Social Circle, GA (Parcel ID: SC23000000006000)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552, I request all records related to the valuation, appraisal, and price justification for the federal acquisition of the property located at 1365 E Hightower Trail, Social Circle, GA 30025 (historically "PNK Loggins 100"). This property was reportedly purchased in February 2026 for approximately $128,555,500 from PNK S1, LLC.

This purchase has generated significant media coverage online, along with social media whispers of Russian oligarchs being involved. For additional information: https://www.gpb.org/news/2026/02/13/ice-bought-warehouse-in-social-circle-ga-the-city-wishes-it-hadnt

Specifically, I request the following:

Independent Appraisal Reports: Any third-party or internal GSA appraisal reports used to determine the "Fair Market Value" of the property prior to the February 2026 sale.

Price Justification Memorandum: Any "Determination and Findings" (D&F) or internal memoranda justifying the payment of a 400%+ premium over the property’s 2025 local tax assessment.

Market Analysis: Any "Market Rent Study" or "Comparative Sales Analysis" (COMPS) performed by GSA or its contractors (e.g., JLL, CBRE, Binswanger) regarding this specific site.

Brokerage Communications: Records of correspondence between GSA and the seller’s representative, Binswanger, regarding price negotiations and the final "Best and Final Offer" (BAFO).

Vetting of Seller: Any "Know Your Customer" (KYC) or beneficial ownership disclosures required from PNK S1, LLC or its parent, PNK Group, as a condition of the sale.

Fee Waiver & Expedited Processing:
I request a fee waiver as this request involves the expenditure of over $128 million in taxpayer funds for a "non-traditional" facility conversion, a matter of significant public concern and media interest in early 2026.

Thank you for the General Services Administration and the administration's commitment to transparency.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

Provide records sufficient to show the following:

1. For each cluster program, provide the number of seats per program and location of program broken down by LRE category of enrolled students (LRE1, LRE2, LRE3).

2. Unfilled seats in each program.

Provide this data as of September 19, 2022.

It is not identifiable information to indicate the number of open seats in a cluster program, even if the number is less than 10. If CPS chooses to withhold this information, please provide an explanation for the withheld information and why CPS believes it to be identifiable.

This request is made on behalf of The FOIA Bakery. Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center.

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: P066679-021626
communications.communication:
Dear Michael Michael: 
Our office received your open records request pursuant to Missouri's Sunshine Law, Chapter 610, RSMo. Your request has been assigned number P066679-021626. The Patrol is committed to adhering to the Sunshine Law and to ensuring that the public obtains access to open records that are not otherwise closed by law. The Sunshine Law requires each public agency to adhere to certain standards. This letter is designed to ensure that you understand our process for fulfilling your records request. Three Business Day Notice Requirement: 
The requested records are not immediately available for dissemination or inspection. The Patrol is required to notify you that additional research time will be required to fulfill the request. This correspondence satisfies the Sunshine Law's notice requirement within the required three business day period. Section 610.023.3, RSMo. 
 Additional Research Time is Required: 
The Patrol receives thousands of open records requests each month. Our Patrol Records Division personnel are dedicated to meeting the intent of Missouri's Sunshine Law and strive to respond to each request in a timely manner. The Patrol operates in all 114 Missouri counties and the independent city of St. Louis. Accordingly, many records maintained by the agency are not centrally located within, or immediately accessible to, the Patrol's Custodian of Records in Jefferson City. Our staff must research your request and ensure that we have captured all responsive records  ̶  regardless of their location within the agency. The research process is time-consuming, but we will make every effort to expedite your request. Estimated Time for Completion: 
The majority of our requests are fulfilled within thirty business days. Some requests require additional research time due to their scope or complexity. Our team will conduct an initial review of your request. If we estimate that the request will be fulfilled within thirty business days, we will not send an updated time estimate. However, if we estimate that the request will take longer than thirty business days, we will provide an updated time estimate that provides a detailed justification for the additional research time. Billing: 
As it relates to billing, Missouri law allows the Patrol to charge fees for copies and research time. Specifically, "[r]esearch time required for fulfilling records requests may be charged at the actual cost of research time." Section 610.026, RSMo. The Missouri Supreme Court recently determined that "staff time is the time required to provide access to public records maintained on computer facilities, recording tapes or disks, videotapes or films, pictures, maps, slides, graphics, illustrations or similar audio or visual items". Gross v. Parson, 624 S.W.3d 877, 884-89 (Mo. 2021) (internal quotations omitted). 
The Patrol will never bill you for redaction time or any research time conducted by our legal staff. You will only be charged for copies and staff research time as permitted by Missouri law. Please let us know if you have questions related to the billing estimate. 
Our team will forward a bill estimate to your attention once we have calculated the permissible costs and fees. The Patrol will not provide the responsive records until receipt of payment. Section 610.026.2, RSMo. 
We appreciate your patience as we review, research, and fulfill your open records request. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you will receive an email when your request has been completed. If you wish to withdraw or clarify your request, or if you have questions, please call our office at (573) 526-6146, or (573) 526-6167. 
 
Sincerely, 
Gerard G. Callahan 
Custodian of Records

title: CPRA Request: Security camera procurement and policies (Carlmont High School/SUHSD)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: CPRA Request: Security camera procurement and policies (Carlmont High School/SUHSD)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Contracts and procurement records
All contracts, purchase orders, invoices, licensing agreements, Requests for Proposals (RFPs), and winning bid responses related to the acquisition, installation, maintenance, licensing, or upgrade of security camera systems at Carlmont High School or district-wide. I request these records for the period of January 1, 2018 through the date this request is fulfilled.

Please note that this request includes documents where Avigilon (including Motorola Solutions), Arecont Vision, or Axis Communications are the manufacturers of the hardware or software, even if the direct contract is with a third-party reseller, system integrator, or installation contractor (e.g., CDW-G, local security vendors, etc.).

Specifically, I seek records regarding:
Hardware: Avigilon H4 and H5A Multisensor series, Axis network cameras, Arecont Vision panoramic cameras, and Network Video Recorders (NVRs).
Software: Avigilon Control Center (ACC) software, "Appearance Search" feature licensing, facial recognition licenses, and any "Focus of Attention" interface licensing.

Procurement records are likely held by the SUHSD Purchasing Department or Administrative Services.

2. Internal and external communications
All email communications between SUHSD staff (specifically: Superintendent, Director of Maintenance & Operations, Director of Technology, Purchasing Managers, and school site administrators [Principals and Vice Principals]) and any representative with an email domain belonging to avigilon.com, motorolasolutions.com, arecontvision.com, or axis.com. I request these records for the period of January 1, 2020 through the date this request is fulfilled.

I also request all internal emails among SUHSD staff containing the specific terms: "Appearance Search," "Facial Recognition," "LPR," "License Plate Recognition," "AI Analytics," "Unusual Motion Detection," "Avigilon Cloud," or "Watch List" for the same time period.

Please note that I am not requesting technical configuration logs or password resets, but rather communications regarding the purchase decision, policy implementation, and capability assessments of these systems.

3. Policies and guidelines
Any written policies, guidelines, memoranda, directives, or Board Policies (BP) and Administrative Regulations (AR) adopted by SUHSD or any individual SUHSD campus governing:
The use of video surveillance on school grounds.
The retention schedule for security footage (how long data is kept before deletion).
Access protocols (who is authorized to view live or recorded footage).
The use of biometric analysis, facial recognition, or video analytics technology.
Any Data Privacy Agreements (DPAs) signed with security vendors regarding the processing of student images.

Policies are likely held by the Superintendent’s Office or Student Services.

To assist in determining my fee status, you should know that I am a student journalist writing for Scot Scoop and that this request is being made as part of news gathering for public distribution.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Maximus Kwan

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Flock Safety ALPR Systems Communications and Access
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) User account audit logs documenting each time a department account has conducted a search or taken another action on the department's Flock Safety ALPR system from 1/1/2024 until the date this request is processed. Flock audit logs are retained indefinitely and contain metadata including, but not limited to: the date of the search, the time of the search, the search term/rules, and the user conducting the search. The audit logs are recorded in a database so I ask that you provide it to me as a .csv, .xls, or other database filetype.
2) Audit logs documenting the access reason for each time a department account has conducted a search on the department's Flock Safety ALPR system from 1/1/2024 until the date this request is processed. The access policy of SFPD for the Flock Safety ALPR system requires a "valid reason". If this valid reason is not recorded anywhere, please indicate as such. If there are audit logs with information regarding ongoing cases and therefore they cannot be provided, please indicate the count of the logs not provided for that reason, and provide the remaining logs that do not have information regarding ongoing cases. Otherwise, if logs contain information that cannot be publicly shared, please redact the information, and provide a reason for the redaction.
3) The names of the hot lists/watch lists used with Flock Safety automated license plate readers (ALPRs)  from 1/1/2024 until the date this request is processed
4) The names of all the agencies with which data is shared with through the Flock Safety ALPR system  from 1/1/2024 until the date this request is processed
5) The names of all the agencies from which data is received through the Flock Safety ALPR system  from 1/1/2024 until the date this request is processed
6) All agreements will local homeowner associations or private business or individuals for access to Flock Safety systems
7) All procurement documents related to Flock Safety
8) All Right-of-Way Installation Permits  relating to the Flock ALPRs
9)  Correspondence (emails, letters, memoranda) discussing installation, operating procedures, presentations, and policy relating to the use and deployment of Flock ALPRs
10) SFPD Internal operating procedures, presentations, and policy relating to the use and deployment of Flock ALPRs
11) Correspondence (emails, letters, memoranda) between SFPD personnel and Flock personnel relating to the purchase, installation, or usage of the ALPRs. Flock's email domain is "flocksafety.com". You may de-duplicate emails as needed in case Flock sends out newsletters or emails to multiple SFPD members. 

In the event that you determine certain records or portions of records are exempt from disclosure, I ask that you provide a detailed explanation of the records or portions of records being withheld and the statutory exemptions under which they are being withheld.
In the event that you determine SFPD does not handle or maintain certain records or portions of records, please indicate which office or department does.

I am requesting these records as a journalist in order to write articles in the public interest about the operations of a government agency.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Austin Theriault

communications.subject: San Francisco Police Public Records Request :: P244160-021526
communications.communication:
Dear Austin Theriault: 
 
Thank you for your interest in public records of the San Francisco Police Department ("SFPD"). 
 
The San Francisco Police Department ("SFPD") received your request, dated February 15, 2026 and given the reference number P244160-021526 for tracking purposes. 
 
Record(s) Requested: To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

1) User account audit logs documenting each time a department account has conducted a search or taken another action on the department's Flock Safety ALPR system from 1/1/2024 until the date this request is processed. Flock audit logs are retained indefinitely and contain metadata including, but not limited to: the date of the search, the time of the search, the search term/rules, and the user conducting the search. The audit logs are recorded in a database so I ask that you provide it to me as a .csv, .xls, or other database filetype. 
2) Audit logs documenting the access reason for each time a department account has conducted a search on the department's Flock Safety ALPR system from 1/1/2024 until the date this request is processed. The access policy of SFPD for the Flock Safety ALPR system requires a "valid reason". If this valid reason is not recorded anywhere, please indicate as such. If there are audit logs with information regarding ongoing cases and therefore they cannot be provided, please indicate the count of the logs not provided for that reason, and provide the remaining logs that do not have information regarding ongoing cases. Otherwise, if logs contain information that cannot be publicly shared, please redact the information, and provide a reason for the redaction. 
3) The names of the hot lists/watch lists used with Flock Safety automated license plate readers (ALPRs) from 1/1/2024 until the date this request is processed 
4) The names of all the agencies with which data is shared with through the Flock Safety ALPR system from 1/1/2024 until the date this request is processed 
5) The names of all the agencies from which data is received through the Flock Safety ALPR system from 1/1/2024 until the date this request is processed 
6) All agreements will local homeowner associations or private business or individuals for access to Flock Safety systems 
7) All procurement documents related to Flock Safety 
8) All Right-of-Way Installation Permits relating to the Flock ALPRs 
9) Correspondence (emails, letters, memoranda) discussing installation, operating procedures, presentations, and policy relating to the use and deployment of Flock ALPRs 
10) SFPD Internal operating procedures, presentations, and policy relating to the use and deployment of Flock ALPRs 
11) Correspondence (emails, letters, memoranda) between SFPD personnel and Flock personnel relating to the purchase, installation, or usage of the ALPRs. Flock's email domain is "flocksafety.com". You may de-duplicate emails as needed in case Flock sends out newsletters or emails to multiple SFPD members. 

In the event that you determine certain records or portions of records are exempt from disclosure, I ask that you provide a detailed explanation of the records or portions of records being withheld and the statutory exemptions under which they are being withheld. 
In the event that you determine SFPD does not handle or maintain certain records or portions of records, please indicate which office or department does. 

I am requesting these records as a journalist in order to write articles in the public interest about the operations of a government agency. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Austin Theriault 

Upload documents directly: https://www.muckrock.com/respond/2217174/ 
 
Your request is being forwarded to the appropriate department(s) for processing and you will be notified once the request is complete. 
 
You can monitor request progress at the link below.  Thank you for using the San Francisco Public Records Center. 
 
 
San Francisco Police Department

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Virginia DOC FOIA
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I would like to request a document containing facility-month level data from January 2024 through December 2025 be provided on the below measures for every prison managed or owned by the Department of Corrections. 
•Overall staff budgeted positions 
•Overall staff filled positions 
•Custody staff budgeted positions 
•Custody staff filled positions 
•Average hours of overall staff overtime used
•Average hours of custody staff overtime used
•Average hours of overall staff sick leave used
•Average hours of custody staff sick leave used
•Overall population count 
•Total number of infractions 
•Total number of violent infractions (including the department’s definition of which infractions are defined as violent) 
•Total number in restricted housing 
•Total number of appeals (grievances) from incarcerated individuals

I am also requesting the name and email of the current, acting, and/or incoming wardens for each facility. This request is made for a scholarly or scientific purpose and not for commercial use. Thank you for your time.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Jessie Harney.

title: To: Palm Bay Police Department – Records Division Subject: Public Records Request: BWC/Dash-Cam (Case #2025-00003532) - Cayla Anne Geib

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Subject: Public Records Request: BWC/Dash-Cam (Case #2025-00003532) - Cayla Anne Geib

Dear Records Custodian,

This is a formal request for all body-worn camera (BWC) and dash-camera footage related to the arrest of Cayla Anne Geib on May 7, 2025.

To ensure the requested footage covers the specific legal and evidentiary elements of the case, please include the following segments:

Standardized Field Sobriety Tests (SFSTs): Full coverage of the roadside sobriety evaluation, including any dash-cam footage that provides a wide-angle view of the subject's physical performance.

The "Resisting" Incident: All footage capturing the specific interaction that led to the charge of Resisting Officer Without Violence. We are specifically looking for the verbal and physical dialogue during the handcuffing or transport process.

Breathalyzer/BAC Evidence: Footage capturing the administration of the breath test (Intoxilyzer), the observation period, and the verbal announcement of the results (BAC levels) or the subject's refusal to provide a sample.

Audio Records: All clear audio of the subject's statements regarding alcohol consumption and the initial accident/property damage.

Please provide a secure link for digital download once the redacted files are ready for release

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Petro Vozniuk

title: Alleged Unlawful Sensitive/Classified Technology Transfer at CalTech/JPL

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records pertaining to alleged espionage and/or violation(s) of the Arms Export Control Act and/or International Traffic in Arms Regulations and related statutes at the California Institute of Technology and/or the Jet Propulsion Laboratory between 2010 and 2017, inclusive. The records I am requesting include, but are not limited to, those pertaining to alleged criminal conduct pertaining to the Electrospray Thruster Array Technology Feasibility Study, which was funded, in part, by the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency.

This request is for any and all responsive records at all relevant department/agency offices and facilities including, but not limited to, headquarters.

In order to facilitate the location of the requested records I am providing the following list of names that may be associated with these allegations and any related Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) inquiry: Amir Gat, Sandra Troian, Daniel Weihs, Morteza Gharib, Kelly M. Sullivan, and, David Tsang.

Upon information and belief, Kelly M. Sullivan and David Tsang were FBI agents with the Los Angeles County Counterintelligence Division at the times relevant to this request. The personal names provided above should not be construed as a basis for limiting the scope of this records request.

In order to help to determine my status to assess fees, you should know that I am a representative of the news media affiliated with the Randolph Bourne Institute and its media outlet, Antiwar.com. This request is made as part of news gathering and not for a commercial use.

I request a waiver of all fees for this request. Disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest because it is likely to contribute significantly to public understanding of the operations or activities of the government and is not primarily in my commercial interest. Specifically, this information will help advance public understanding of foreign intelligence activities targeted against the United States of America.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Michelle Kinnucan

title: Public records request CPAC Norfolk County/Case-Theresa Corley

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Public records request CPAC Norfolk County/Case-Theresa Corley
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

State Police Personnel & Evidence Transfer Request
TO: Records Access Officer (RAO), Massachusetts State Police
RE: Public Records Request – CPAC Norfolk County / Case Theresa Corley Bellingham MA (1978-79)

To the Records Access Officer:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law (M.G.L. c. 66, § 10), I am requesting the following records regarding the investigative team assigned to the Dec. 1978 homicide of Theresa Corley in Bellingham, MA:

The Duty Roster / Personnel List: A list of all State Police officers assigned to the Norfolk County CPAC Unit between December 1, 1978, and February 28, 1979.

The Evidence Transfer Receipt (The "Blue Slip"): Any record, ledger entry, or receipt documenting the transfer of biological evidence (swabs/slides) from the Bellingham Police Department to the State Police during this period.

Command Structure: The name of the Commanding Officer (CO) or Lieutenant-in-Charge of the Norfolk CPAC unit at the time of the investigation.

Evidence Storage Logs: Records identifying the specific facility where Norfolk County homicide evidence was transported for "secondary storage" or "testing" in early 1979 (e.g., the 1010 Commonwealth Ave Lab or the Southern Mortuary).

Please note: While personnel files are often protected, Duty Rosters and Command Structures are public records. I am seeking these names to identify the chain of custody for evidence that has been erroneously labeled as "lost in a fire."

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

GERALDINE HOUDE

title: Procedures for Transportation of ICE Detainees

communications.subject: Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act Request: Procedures for Transportation of ICE Detainees
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Transportation procedures and contracts for the transportation of ICE detainees, including but not limited to: 
Policy for the timeline of informing ICE detainees in advance of transfer/deportation
Policy for personal possessions of ICE detainees during transfer
Security policies including use of restraints
Policies for bathroom facilities and food for ICE detainees during transfer 
Contracts pertaining to transportation of ICE detainees

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sophia Wright

communications.subject: Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act Request: Emergency Contingency Plans
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Emergency contingency plans including:
Plans for assisting detainees with special needs
Chain of command
Emergency recall list
Facility access routes
Post emergency procedures
Fire control plan
Contracts with vendors for emergency evacuation

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sophia Wright

title: Fire at the Old Mortuary Boston MA

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Fire at the Old Mortuary Boston MA
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all "Field Reports, Duty Logs, or Administrative Memoranda from the years 1979 to 1983 regarding a site visit by State Police Personnel ( Sgt Brian Brooks and Lt. Shea of the NCDA office) to the Suffolk County Southern Mortuary 784 Mass. Ave) to assess damage to evidence following a fire/flood event. I am looking for the specific inventory regarding the homicide of my sister, Theresa Corley.  The evidence was declared by Sgt Brooks as a "total loss" at that time.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

GERALDINE HOUDE
